p: In order to determine the nonlethal dose of the Inula viscosa plant extract, a toxicity test was performed. In fact, decreasing concentrations and/or volumes of the extract were used until obtaining a dose that does not cause lethality on mice. This dose was then used in the same mouse for 4 days, a period chosen to mimic the protocol used during the treatment with the extracts. The volume used was 25 μL and adjusted to 100 μL using phosphate-buffered saline (PBS). The anticancer potential of the prepared extract was evaluated by administering 100 μL of the extract to mice as skin cancer was in parallel induced.
